locutie.beschrijving: The preacher explains the concept of 'repose' in the Lord's Prayer, using Psalm 27 as a case study for seeking God's presence amidst life's terrors and family rejection.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High. Detailed focus on Hebrew intensity ('one thing'), the nature of the Tabernacle, and the Christological fulfillment of the 'tabernacling' Word.

illocutie.beschrijving: Primarily teaching and explaining (Assertive), transitioning into invitation and comfort (Commissive) via the work of Christ.
voorbeelden: I want to show you what he’s not doing.
To gaze on the beauty of God means...

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: The hearer should move from anxiety/distraction to a state of 'repose' and desire for God's presence.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Moderate; mentions the Spirit's role in regeneration and 'shedding love abroad' in the heart.

voorbeelden: The Lord’s Prayer is quite a workout.
Augustine said that is so wrong and yet so right.
I don’t even like thinking about it.
I remember how sick I felt.

commissieven.kwaliteit: Strongly grounded in the substitutionary work of Christ (The 'forsakenness' of Jesus).

declaratieven.autoriteit: Derived from the office of the Word, though often phrased as an explanation of a state rather than a direct 'I forgive you'.

indicatoren: Extensive use of 'Augustine says', 'Edwards says', 'The commentator says'.
Long explanations of the difference between useful and beautiful.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer understands the *concept* of repose but may not immediately *experience* the event of being addressed by God.

missende_elementen: Direct sacramental address ('Today, God says to you...')
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The sermon feels like a very high-quality lecture on prayer rather than a divine encounter until the final Christological turn.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: Very high; specifically links the hearer's potential rejection to Christ's actual rejection.
voorbeelden: God will not forsake you, because on the cross Jesus Christ said, 'My God, my God, why hast thou forsaken me?'

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Personal anecdotes (son, friend's husband) and 'we' in teaching.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct application and the 'you' of the promise at the end.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used effectively in the final 5 minutes.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Analyzing David, Augustine, and the biblical text.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a 'classroom' atmosphere for the first two-thirds.

foutief_patroon.beschrijving: Avoids simple moralism (Directive) by grounding everything in the 'One Thing' (God's beauty).

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Moves from the terror of life (Assertive) to the beauty of Christ (Declarative) to the promise of non-forsakenness (Commissive).
voorbeelden: Jesus took the forsakenness... so God will not forsake you.
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: The logic is sound, though the 'Declarative' force is slightly softened by the explanatory tone.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: Because he was taking the forsakenness we deserve... you can know God will open to you.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon is a masterpiece of 'teaching toward comfort,' using intellectual rigor to dismantle emotional barriers before delivering the Gospel promise.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: He was taking the forsakenness we deserve, so that... God will not forsake you.
sterke_punten.effect: Moves the sermon from 'talking about God' to 'God acting for you'.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: Saint Augustine was raised with the Greek philosophers...
zwakke_punten.probleem: The heavy reliance on historical/philosophical citations can delay the 'event' of the Word.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It becomes an event in the final third when the 'forsakenness' of the hearer is met by the 'forsakenness' of Christ.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The link between the Word (Psalm 27) and the Sacrament (Christ's body/sacrifice) is explicitly made.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Implicitly, through the 'Word of the Lord' and the preacher's application of the promise.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Yes, especially in the 'I tell you' and 'you can know' sections.
tekstueel_bewijs: I know what should go on in our minds...

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: Yes, as the one who makes God 'beautiful' to the heart.
pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Yes, the preacher acknowledges that only the Spirit-regenerated heart finds God beautiful.
tekstueel_bewijs: only a person whose heart has been regenerated... by the Holy Spirit will ever find him beautiful.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Yes, the sermon functions as a 'toezegging' (promise) of grace.
tekstueel_bewijs: The Word became flesh and tabernacled among us.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is heavy on 'is' and 'says' (Assertive). It needs more 'I declare' or 'God promises' (Declarative/Commissive).

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: Jesus is the reason why we can go in.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Because of Jesus, I declare to you: the door is open. Enter in.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Shifts from a fact about Jesus to an action performed for the hearer.

toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Move the toezegging earlier to flavor the 'teaching' sections.
voorbeeldzinnen: Even now, God is bearing you up.

adressering_verbetering.probleem: Too much 'David did this' and 'Augustine said that'.
adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Use the 'Homiletical You' more frequently in the middle section.
voorbeeldzinnen: You, like David, are facing an army of anxieties.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A profound example of how intellectual exegesis can serve a performative end. The Christological finish saves the sermon from being merely a lecture.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on Keller's 'Self-Revelation' (the story of his son); SAT focuses on the 'Declarative' power of the Gospel to change the hearer's status before God.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetoric seeks to persuade; this sermon seeks to 'be' the place where the hearer gazes on God.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the sermon's power isn't in the 'Mozart' illustration, but in the 'Commissive' act where the preacher binds God's promise to the hearer's specific pain.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: Jesus was taking the forsakenness we deserve.

appendices.notities: The sermon successfully navigates the 'terror of creation' by moving from a constative description of fear to a performative promise of presence.
